articles.title: INNOVATION: Purple bacteria may help harvest green fuel from wastewater - ETEnergyworld.com
articles.description: The study showed that supplying electric current to purple phototrophic bacteria can recover nearly 100 per cent of carbon from any type of organic waste, while generating hydrogen gas for electricity production

articles.author: Shashank Kumar
articles.title: Climate change: Arctic lost nearly 95% of its old ice since 1984 - Hindustan Times
articles.description: According scientists at NASA, the area covered by Arctic sea ice at least four years old has decreased from 1,860,000 square kilometres in September 1984 to 110,000 square kilometres in September 2016.
articles.content:
The Arctic has lost almost 95% of its older ice cover since 1984, according to NASA.
The ice in the Arctic grows and shrinks through the year, and is made up of seasonal and perennial ice. The peren… [+2053 chars]
